annotation.spannedText: You should be immunised against typhoid before you travel to certain countries where the risk of typhoid is high - in particular, countries in the Indian subcontinent

classMention.mentionClass: You should be immunised against typhoid before you travel to certain countries where the risk of typhoid is high - in particular, countries in the Indian subcontinent

annotation.spannedText: Travellers to areas where typhoid is a problem should be immunised, particularly where hygiene and sanitation are poor

classMention.mentionClass: Travellers to areas where typhoid is a problem should be immunised, particularly where hygiene and sanitation are poor

annotation.spannedText: The worst affected areas are Asia, Africa, and Central and South America, so you should be immunised if visiting these countries, especially if you are visiting friends and relatives

classMention.mentionClass: The worst affected areas are Asia, Africa, and Central and South America, so you should be immunised if visiting these countries, especially if you are visiting friends and relatives

annotation.spannedText: Your GP or practice nurse can advise if you should be immunised against typhoid for your travel destination

classMention.mentionClass: Your GP or practice nurse can advise if you should be immunised against typhoid for your travel destination

annotation.spannedText: People who handle specimens which may contain typhoid germs (bacteria) should also be immunised

classMention.mentionClass: People who handle specimens which may contain typhoid germs (bacteria) should also be immunised

annotation.spannedText: It is important to remember that not everyone who is vaccinated will be totally protected against typhoid fever

classMention.mentionClass: It is important to remember that not everyone who is vaccinated will be totally protected against typhoid fever

annotation.spannedText: No vaccine is 100% effective

classMention.mentionClass: No vaccine is 100% effective

annotation.spannedText: Each capsule should be taken with cold or lukewarm liquid (no warmer than 37oC), approximately one hour before a meal

classMention.mentionClass: Each capsule should be taken with cold or lukewarm liquid (no warmer than 37oC), approximately one hour before a meal

annotation.spannedText: It should be swallowed whole as soon as possible after being placed in the mouth, and not chewed

classMention.mentionClass: It should be swallowed whole as soon as possible after being placed in the mouth, and not chewed

annotation.spannedText: The oral vaccine should be completed one week before you travel, as protection takes at least seven days to begin

classMention.mentionClass: The oral vaccine should be completed one week before you travel, as protection takes at least seven days to begin

annotation.spannedText: This oral vaccine should only be given to children over 6 years of age

classMention.mentionClass: This oral vaccine should only be given to children over 6 years of age

annotation.spannedText: Most malaria tablets should not be taken for at least three days after receiving the oral vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Most malaria tablets should not be taken for at least three days after receiving the oral vaccine

annotation.spannedText: It should be given at least two weeks before you travel, ideally one month before

classMention.mentionClass: It should be given at least two weeks before you travel, ideally one month before

annotation.spannedText: It should not be given to: People with an illness with high temperature (fever)

classMention.mentionClass: It should not be given to: People with an illness with high temperature (fever)

annotation.spannedText: It is best to wait until the illness has subsided before being immunised

classMention.mentionClass: It is best to wait until the illness has subsided before being immunised

annotation.spannedText: The oral vaccine should not be given to: People who have had an allergy to gelatin

classMention.mentionClass: The oral vaccine should not be given to: People who have had an allergy to gelatin

annotation.spannedText: there is no reason to believe the vaccine risks harm to the mother or baby, so it is used if travel is essential and the risk of typhoid is high

classMention.mentionClass: there is no reason to believe the vaccine risks harm to the mother or baby, so it is used if travel is essential and the risk of typhoid is high

annotation.spannedText: when you travel to at-risk areas you should: Have good personal hygiene

classMention.mentionClass: when you travel to at-risk areas you should: Have good personal hygiene

annotation.spannedText: Only drink water or other drinks that are known to be safe (bottled water, sterilised water, etc)

classMention.mentionClass: Only drink water or other drinks that are known to be safe (bottled water, sterilised water, etc)

annotation.spannedText: Only eat foods that have been cleaned and/or prepared properly

classMention.mentionClass: Only eat foods that have been cleaned and/or prepared properly
